reviewText: Saw this on Hulu.com twice and then decided to buy it.  You have to see the flying shots to believe them.  The story line is predictable.  Pilots will quickly note that the "rules" have been adapted to fit the film, but it's all in good fun.  This is one of the few flying videos I know of that my wife actually liked.

This is worth watching because the flying scenes are so terrific: there is stunt flying, precision low-level  flying in the mountains, a glider flight, and so on. Some of it is spectacular and it is beautifully photographed.

To see the flying you have to put with the framing device, a typical cliched imax story about a single young female journalist who is afraid of flying but gets the opportunity when she is interviewing a single good looking young pilot. Gee, I wonder what's going to happen?
